intro: Burghartia villosa, commonly known as the woolly burghartia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Burghartia villosa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
